S

scalar - Variable in class Vector3DTest
 
scene - Variable in class main.Controller
 
scene - Variable in class renderer.Renderer
 
Scene - Class in renderer
The Scene class holds everything that can be viewed through the camera.
Scene() - Constructor for class renderer.Scene
The empty Scene constructor sets the background color of the scene to black and initializes the sceneObjects, geometries and lights lists.
SceneObject - Class in renderer
The SceneObject is the abstract parent class of all the objects that can be added to the Scene.
SceneObject() - Constructor for class renderer.SceneObject
 
sceneObjects - Variable in class renderer.Scene
 
setColor(Color) - Method in class renderer.SceneObject
Also currently not in use, but might be useful at a later stage.
setOrigin(Vector3D) - Method in class renderer.Camera
The setOrigin method is used to move the camera around.
setPosition(Vector3D) - Method in class renderer.SceneObject
Currently not in use, but might be useful at a later stage.
setT(double) - Method in class utilities.Ray
 
shade(RayHit, int) - Method in class renderer.Renderer
The shade method is used to loop through all the lights in the scene to check if we intersect a light from the point on the object.
shape - Variable in class utilities.RayHit
 
Shape - Class in geometries
Abstract class Shape from which geometries can inherit the abstract method intersects.
Shape() - Constructor for class geometries.Shape
 
Sphere - Class in geometries
The Sphere class is a geometry that extends the abstract Shape class which has the abstract method 'intersects' to see if a ray intersects with a geometry.
Sphere(Vector3D, double, Color, float) - Constructor for class geometries.Sphere
Creates a new Sphere object with the specified position as it's center, a radius, a color and a reflection value.
startRenderer() - Method in class main.Controller
The startRenderer function calls the render method of the renderer object and passes the initialized Image object as an argument to it.
subtract(Vector3D) - Method in class utilities.Vector3D
The subtract method subtracts this Vector3D object from the Vector3D object given as a parameter.
